PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mr. Pless Lackey, 7937 Tioga Street and John S. Williams, 319 Tenth Street, McKeesport, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 11, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe youngsters in their early teens, that is from 13 to 16 years of age, should be permitted to smoke cigarettes or drink alcoholic beverages?" Mr. Pless Lackey's answer reads: "No, because they are too young. They should wait until they get older and understand life before they begin using such things as cigarettes and alcoholic beverages."  John S. Williams' answer reads: "No, because they are too young and they have not matured enough to receive that kind of abuse, because it will ruin their health."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Pless Lackey, and John S. Williams wearing striped shirt, standing on sidewalk with storefronts and signs, including one on right that reads "Discount"
